Number of Nodes

:   $|v|$

Characteristic path length

:   $Z$ = Average seperation between two nodes in the graph

Diameter

:   Longest of all the shortest paths

Degree distribution

:   Edges vs Degree (y vs x)

:   ![](images/clipboard-1869134462.png)

Clustering coefficient

:   ![Explains "Cliqueness" or how tightly the nodes are clustered](images/clipboard-491489713.png)

Closeness Centrality

:   $C_c = \frac{1}{\sum_{v \in V}{d_G(u, v)}}$ where $d_G$ is the shortest path (geodesic) on the graph $G(V,E)$

Betweeness Centrality

:   Fraction of shortest paths that cross through $c$ node

    $C_B(v) = \sum_{s \not = t \not = v| s, t, v \in V}{\frac{\sigma_{st}(v)}{\sigma_{st}}}$ where $\sigma_{st}$ is the number of shortest paths between $s$ and $t$ that pass through $v$

Motifs

:   Statistically significantly Over representated sub graphs (patterns)

## Network Models

### Erdos Reyni Random network

Basically there are $n$ nodes and $p$ is the probability of edge. Take a pair of nodes, toss a coin, see if the probability is greater than or equal to the user given probability. If yes, create an edge otherwise no edge.

```{r, echo=FALSE}
# Load the necessary library
library(igraph)

# Set parameters for the Erdős–Rényi model
n <- 1000  # Number of nodes in the graph
p <- 0.2  # Probability of edge creation between each pair of nodes

# Generate the Erdős–Rényi model graph
random_graph <- erdos.renyi.game(n, p, directed = FALSE)

# Calculate the degree of each node
degree_list <- degree(random_graph)

# Plot the degree distribution as a histogram
hist(degree_list, breaks = 20, probability = TRUE, col = "blue",
     xlab = "Degree (k)", ylab = "n(k)",
     main = "Degree Distribution of ER Model Graph",
     ylim = c(0, max(table(degree_list)) * 1.1))

# Add a line showing the theoretical Poisson distribution
# Mean of the Poisson distribution is np
lambda <- n * p
x <- 0:max(degree_list)
pois_prob <- dpois(x, lambda)
lines(x, pois_prob * length(degree_list), col = "red", lwd = 2)

# Add a legend
legend("topright", legend = c("Observed", "Poisson"), col = c("blue", "red"),
       lwd = 2, bty = "n")


```
